body_html:
@tatatodd Thanks, directly using tf.data.TFRecordDataset works!
>>> from tf.data import TFRecordDataset
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "<stdin>", line 1, in
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tf'
>>> tf.data.TFRecordDataset('filename.tfrecord')
<TFRecordDataset shapes: (), types: tf.string>

What could be the cause of it? I have a Windows PC with TF r1.4 installed with pip giving exactly the same error...

body:
@tatatodd Thanks, directly using `tf.data.TFRecordDataset` works!
\>\>\> `from tf.data import TFRecordDataset`
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "\<stdin\>", line 1, in <module>
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tf'
\>\>\> `tf.data.TFRecordDataset('filename.tfrecord')`
<TFRecordDataset shapes: (), types: tf.string>

What could be the cause of it? I have a Windows PC with TF r1.4 installed with pip giving exactly the same error...
